item.title: Cartoon by Lisa Benson
item.description: Lisa Benson cartoon on Democrats and Republicans negotiating a stopgap spending bill.

item.title: Cuba is collapsing. That’s an opportunity for Trump — and the island.
item.description: The president’s love of a deal could drive meaningful change.

item.title: America’s mistrust is misplaced. Minneapolis shows why.
item.description: The chaos points to a flaw that Black history exposed — and reconstruction can fix.

item.title: JD Vance vies for the gold medal in coarseness and flippancy
item.description: The vice president has a knack for late — very late — adolescent naughtiness.

item.title: How Trump is forcing Europe’s pivot to India
item.description: E.U. eyes New Delhi for a reliable partner as a hedge against American uncertainty.

item.title: Americans are tough graders on Trump’s economy
item.description: Rising wages haven’t erased memories of inflation or the shock of higher prices.

item.title: I joined a MAHA roundtable. What I heard surprised me.
item.description: The discussion was more complex and constructive than much public discourse would suggest.

item.title: Spanberger promised affordability. A decision on unions will test that.
item.description: Governor should keep her campaign pledge and resist mandatory collective bargaining.

item.title: An economist explains why he’s still ‘bullish on America’ — AI and all
item.description: Artificial intelligence is moving fast, with new tools changing how people work, create and compete. Whether you’re an AI doomer or AI boomer, it’s hard to ignore what’s coming. Economist and professor Tyler Cowen has spent years analyzing how these developments could reshape the economy and everyday life. He joins host Megan McArdle to talk through how AI could transform talent, human capital and competition — and how to make sure you don’t get left behind.

item.title: No wonder the number of foreign visitors is falling
item.description: Denying visas to people never charged with a crime is bad for tourism and America’s image.

item.title: EPA is right to reverse Obama overreach
item.description: If the federal government wants to more heavily regulate greenhouse gas emissions, Congress needs to pass a new law.

item.title: How to rein in ICE without undermining its mission
item.description: Oversight, training and warrants, with some humility, will help the agency rebuild trust.

item.title: Olympians, leave politics at home
item.description: Readers on the Olympics, Football prayer, Billie Eilish’s Land acknowledgement, Sonny Jurgensen and more.

item.title: Trump starts another needless face-off with Canada
item.description: Icing the Gordie Howe bridge is an own goal.

item.title: Cartoon by Joe Heller
item.description: Joe Heller cartoon on Valentine’s Day and cupid losing his job to AI.

item.title: The video game that started it all
item.description: A multibillion-dollar industry traces its roots to the 1970s breakthrough of Atari’s “Pong.”

item.title: U.S. universities have lost sight of their core task
item.description: It’s time for higher education to get back to educating the workforce of the future.

item.title: The autism epidemic is a myth
item.description: Most new cases reflect mild or no significant impairment. Moderate and severe cases have declined.

item.title: This drug treats myopia. I’m sick of telling patients they can’t have it.
item.description: American children with myopia deserve better than this regulatory failure.

item.title: 26 is the new 22. Why not for this Social Security program?
item.description: The age cutoff reflects an outdated assumption about how adulthood unfolds.

item.title: Trump is making voters uneasy. Democrats are pushing them away.
item.description: Punishing the wealthy might make Democrats feel good, but it won’t convince many voters.

item.title: We may be doing breast cancer screening all wrong
item.description: This test may be crucial for breast cancer screening. It’s not a mammogram.

item.title: It’s Taxachusetts for a reason
item.description: The Bay State is losing businesses and residents to lower-tax competitors.

item.title: California to Seahawks: Pay up
item.description: Winning the Super Bowl in California means more taxes than winning it somewhere else.

item.title: The lion’s share
item.description: Michael Ramirez cartoon on the impact of the Epstein files in U.S. versus U.K.

item.title: Snow should not be an emergency. Keep DMV kids in school.
item.description: Readers on issues such as snow removal, the debt crisis, D.C. Health and the Potomac sewage spill
